messages.messageBody:
1/12/03 22:48:

> One thing that has stood out to me since I began reading here is
> the way other people talk about their kids! I was watching
> Antwone Fisher today (at the theater) and found myself aghast at
> how often adults are telling kids what they can and can't do,
> what's good for them, what they ought to be thankful for and so
> on. Even in some of the other homeschool places I post and
> read, there is such a huge emphasis on how to push, contain,
> influence, shape, cajole and ultimately control our kids--not just
> behaviors, but also their thoughts and values too!

This point, Julie, was when it all really hit me. This is where I suddenly
started feeling completely out of step with the entire world. As a society,
we're so used to hearing kids demeaned.

> I'm amazed I hadn't noticed it quite so much before.

Once you get used to thinking differently, it jumps out at you like a
scream.

I love unschooling. I love my life, and all the things I've changed in the
last year have done fabulous things for my relationship with my son. But
sometimes I think it would be nice to fit in. I can't do it. But it would
be nice.

brenda
